taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section alleghenienses;species inclinis;

treatment.description: Slender, with ascending angled primocanes and arching or leaning floricanes; primocanes with remote slender prickles, rufous pubescence and many stipitate glands; leaves dull; those of primocane soft-pubescent beneath, with glandular and prickly petiole and petiolules; terminal leaflet ovate, subcordate; inflorescence a few long-pedicelled flowers in the axils of the median long-petioled simple or 3-foliolate acute simply toothed bracts, with simple leaves produced well above the flowers.
